alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of gusty showers will impact portions of central Kanawha, northeastern Lincoln and northwestern Boone Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers from Palermo to Charleston, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Madison, Jefferson, South Charleston, Dunbar, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Spurlockville, Coal Fork, Alum Creek, Julian, Tornado, Danville, Turtle Creek, Ashford, Palermo, Alkol, Mud and Yawkey. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 106. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 52 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 86 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 47 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.
